main event: A B-29 aircraft crew reported observing a bluish-green fireball during their operation near Cedar Keys, Florida on January 29, 1952.
interesting points: The fireball was reported to be of a bright, blue hue and traveled at a high rate of speed in a straight level course., The estimated size of the fireball was about the size of a dinner plate at arm's length., The crew observed the fireball approximately 30 degrees above and to the left of their aircraft., The object seemed to explode as it approached the ground, leaving a glowing tail estimated to be 150 feet long., The sighting lasted for approximately 3 seconds.
